Package org.water.bluetooth.application.executor.connection.http

Class HTTPPOST

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
org.water.bluetooth.application.executor.connection.http.HTTPPOST
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class HTTPPOST extends Thread
The HTTPPOST class represents an HTTP POST request thread that sends data received from a remote device via Bluetooth communication to a server using the specified data type.

This class extends the Thread class and is designed to be instantiated for each HTTP POST request to the server. It includes methods for constructing and executing the HTTP POST request, handling the response, and determining the appropriate endpoint based on the data type.

Since:
2023-12-09
Version:
1.0
Author:
gubbriaco, agrandinetti, fnicoletti

  • Constructor Details

    • HTTPPOST

      public HTTPPOST(String data, DataType dataType) throws IllegalArgumentException, MalformedURLException, IOException
      Constructs an HTTPPOST object with the specified data and data type.
      Parameters:
      data - The data coming from the remote device via Bluetooth communication and to be used for the HTTP POST request to the server.
      dataType - Type of data to be used for the HTTP POST request to the server.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the data type is undefined.
      MalformedURLException - If the URL is malformed.
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

      private String getEndPoint(DataType dataType) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns the endpoint corresponding to the specified data type for the HTTP POST request.
      Parameters:

      Returns:

      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided data type is undefined.
